## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been digging into the options for running Verus and I have a few questions. What does the `-sendfreetransactions` option do when running Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-sendfreetransactions` option allows Verus to send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible. This option is set to 0 by default, meaning it is disabled unless explicitly enabled. Do you have any other questions about Verus options?

**User:**
Actually, yes. What is the purpose of the `-spendzeroconfchange` option in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-spendzeroconfchange` option allows Verus to spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions. This option is set to 1 by default, meaning it is enabled. Would you like to know about any other options?

**User:**
How does the `-storagefeefactor` option affect the pricing of storage in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-storagefeefactor` option determines the pricing of storage in Verus. The default value is 6.0, which means that the storage fee is equivalent to 1 TransactionExportFee per 6 kilobytes of data. This factor can be adjusted to change the pricing of storage. Do you have any questions about storage in Verus?

**User:**
What is the purpose of the `-txconfirmtarget` option in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-txconfirmtarget` option determines how quickly transactions are confirmed in Verus. If the `paytxfee` option is not set, Verus will include a fee in transactions to ensure they are confirmed within a certain number of blocks. The default value is 2, meaning transactions are targeted to be confirmed within 2 blocks on average. Do you have any other questions about transaction confirmation?

**User:**
What happens to transactions that are not mined within a certain number of blocks in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
Transactions that are not mined within a certain number of blocks in Verus will become invalid. This number of blocks is determined by the `-txexpirydelta` option, which has a minimum value of 4 and a default value of 20 (pre-Blossom) or 40 (post-Blossom). Do you have any questions about transaction expiration?

**User:**
What is the purpose of the `-walletbroadcast` option in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-walletbroadcast` option determines whether the wallet in Verus will broadcast transactions. This option is set to 1 by default, meaning the wallet will broadcast transactions. Do you have any other questions about the wallet in Verus?

**User:**
What is the purpose of the `-walletnotify` option in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-walletnotify` option allows Verus to execute a command when a wallet transaction changes. The command specified can include a `%s` placeholder, which will be replaced with the TxID of the transaction. Do you have any questions about wallet notifications?

**User:**
What is the purpose of the `-zapwallettxes` option in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-zapwallettxes` option allows Verus to delete all wallet transactions and only recover those parts of the blockchain through a rescan on startup. The option takes a mode parameter, which can be set to 1 to keep transaction metadata (e.g. account owner and payment request information) or 2 to drop transaction metadata. Do you have any more questions about Verus options or configuration?
AI Assistant
N/A
What does the `-sendfreetransactions` option do when running Verus?
The `-sendfreetransactions` option allows Verus to send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible. This option is set to 0 by default, meaning it is disabled unless explicitly enabled.

`-sendfreetransactions`
    Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)`-spendzeroconfchange`
    Spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions (default: 1)`-storagefeefactor`
    Defaults to 6.0, which is used for 6K outputs to price storage in a currency's TransactionExportFee (ie. 6.0 = 1 TransactionExportFee per K).`-txconfirmtarget=<n>`
    If paytxfee is not set, include enough fee so transactions begin
    confirmation on average within n blocks (default: 2)`-txexpirydelta`
    Set the number of blocks after which a transaction that has not been
    mined will become invalid (min: 4, default: 20 (pre-Blossom) or 40
    (post-Blossom))`-upgradewallet`
    Upgrade wallet to latest format on startup`-wallet=<file>`
    Specify wallet file (within data directory) (default: wallet.dat)`-walletbroadcast`
    Make the wallet broadcast transactions (default: 1)`-walletnotify=<cmd>`
    Execute command when a wallet transaction changes (%s in cmd is replaced
    by TxID)`-zapwallettxes=<mode>`
    Delete all wallet transactions and only recover those parts of the
    blockchain through -rescan on startup (1 = keep tx meta data e.g.
    account owner and payment request information, 2 = drop tx meta data)## ZeroMQ notification options:`-zmqpubhashblock=<address>`
    Enable publish hash block in <address>`-zmqpubhashtx=<address>`
    Enable publish hash transaction in <address>`-zmqpubrawblock=<address>`
    Enable publish raw block in <address>`-zmqpubrawtx=<address>`
    Enable publish raw transaction in <address>## AMQP 1.0 notification options:
all AMQP support options require `-experimentalfeatures`.`-amqppubhashblock=<address>`
   Enable publish hash block in <address>`-amqppubhashtx=<address>`
   Enable publish hash transaction in <address>

What is the purpose of the `-zapwallettxes` option in Verus?

The `-zapwallettxes` option allows Verus to delete all wallet transactions and only recover those parts of the blockchain through a rescan on startup. The option takes a mode parameter, which can be set to 1 to keep transaction metadata (e.g. account owner and payment request information) or 2 to drop transaction metadata.

`-sendfreetransactions`
    Send transactions as zero-fee transactions if possible (default: 0)`-spendzeroconfchange`
    Spend unconfirmed change when sending transactions (default: 1)`-storagefeefactor`
    Defaults to 6.0, which is used for 6K outputs to price storage in a currency's TransactionExportFee (ie. 6.0 = 1 TransactionExportFee per K).`-txconfirmtarget=<n>`
    If paytxfee is not set, include enough fee so transactions begin
    confirmation on average within n blocks (default: 2)`-txexpirydelta`
    Set the number of blocks after which a transaction that has not been
    mined will become invalid (min: 4, default: 20 (pre-Blossom) or 40
    (post-Blossom))`-upgradewallet`
    Upgrade wallet to latest format on startup`-wallet=<file>`
    Specify wallet file (within data directory) (default: wallet.dat)`-walletbroadcast`
    Make the wallet broadcast transactions (default: 1)`-walletnotify=<cmd>`
    Execute command when a wallet transaction changes (%s in cmd is replaced
    by TxID)`-zapwallettxes=<mode>`
    Delete all wallet transactions and only recover those parts of the
    blockchain through -rescan on startup (1 = keep tx meta data e.g.
    account owner and payment request information, 2 = drop tx meta data)## ZeroMQ notification options:`-zmqpubhashblock=<address>`
